Are you launching this as an application from eclipse?  Do you have the 
swt.jar and swt-pi.jar on the classpath?  In 3.0 M9 swt.jar was split into two 
jars (swt.jar and swt-pi.jar) for legal reasons.  Please make sure you have 
both jars on the classpath.

Yes I am. After putting the swt-pi.jar on the class path (via
Project->property->Java Build Path->Library) the problem did go away. Thank you
for your help.

Just one more question:
I understand that for legal reason you have to split swt.jar the two. Doesn't
this makes Mac version behave subtlely different from others? Is there any plan
to change this?

Thank you very much for your help. Can you please close this bug report if you
are satisfy with it? Thanking you in advance.

Best regards,
Cinly

The jar is split into two components on Mac and GTK.  Motif also requires 
multiple jars if the browser widget is used.  In reality, Windows is the 
expection with only one jar.  For consistency, post 3.0 we may consider 
splitting the jar for all platforms.
